definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on
to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to draw support from/with the help of
to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext
to borrow sth for another use/to borrow an idea for one's own use
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet

to make use of/to use sth as pretext/under false pretenses/under the guise of/masquerading as/lenient/tolerant/loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan

sentences.english: With the chance of Universiade, Shenzhen proposes to build a voluntary city with the effort of all citizens.
sentences.chinese: 借大运会契机，深圳提出全民共建“志愿之城”。

sentences.english: The law was put into effect through angels by a mediator.
sentences.chinese: 并且是借天使经中保之手设立的。

sentences.english: You can borrow them if you like.
sentences.chinese: 如果你喜欢，你可以借去。

sentences.english: Do you mind if I borrow theis newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你介意我借这份报纸吗？

sentences.english: I'm terribly sorry. I lost the magazineyou lent me last week.
sentences.chinese: 真对不直，我把你上周借我的杂丢了。

sentences.english: We only made two and I promised one to my mom. You could borrow mine.
sentences.chinese: 我们只制作了两张，还答应给妈妈一张，你可借我的。

sentences.english: The neighbor often borrowed my inflator.
sentences.chinese: 邻居经常借我家的打气筒。

sentences.english: See the two men to escape, Li master by telephone to the police report to the police.
sentences.chinese: 见两名男子逃跑后，李师傅借电话向警方报警。

sentences.english: I asked her for the dictionary she borrowed from me, but she just fobbed me off with a stupid excuse.
sentences.chinese: 借我的字典还给我，她却胡乱找个借口把我搪塞过去。

sentences.english: Could I borrow your car again tonight?
sentences.chinese: 明晚可再借你的车一用吗？

sentences.english: One trainee persuaded a farmer to lend him his light truck, so he could get cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 有一位受训者试图向一位农民借他的轻型卡车去买烟。

sentences.english: Most borrowed from my sister or swimming, to finish the task.
sentences.chinese: 最还是向本人妹妹借了游泳镜，才完成任务。

sentences.english: I know I owe you a lot of money, but can I borrow a little more?
sentences.chinese: 我知道我已经欠你很多钱了，但是我能再借一些么？
我们能借一个冲浪板吗？

sentences.english: Finally could not help you borrow that book really sorry.
sentences.chinese: 最后没能帮你们借到那本书真的很遗憾。

sentences.english: Lily ( ) some money ( ) me the other week.
sentences.chinese: 莉莉前几周向我借了点钱。

definition: to borrow sth for another use/to borrow an idea for one's own use
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
excuse me (i.e. let me through, please)
to rotate/to circulate (cash, stock etc)/turnover/circulation/cash flow
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
